question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable and ready for demonstration. I want to create a software about Chaoshan, including calendars with important dates for different regions, customs and traditions, and forum-like features (similar to WeChat Moments).

checklist.title: Is the calendar system with regional important dates fully implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate the calendar implementation to see if it properly displays important Chaoshan regional dates and events. Check whether it supports customization for different regions within Chaoshan (Chaozhou, Shantou, Jieyang), includes lunar calendar conversion for traditional festivals, and offers filtering/categorization of events. Score 0 if the calendar system is not implemented, 5 if basic calendar functionality exists but lacks regional specificity, and 10 if the implementation is comprehensive with region-specific important dates and proper cultural annotation.

checklist.title: How well are the Chaoshan customs and traditions documented and presented?
checklist.description: Assess the quality and comprehensiveness of the cultural content. Check if the code implements interactive displays of Chaoshan traditions (such as Kungfu Tea ceremony, Chaoshan cuisine, opera), includes multimedia elements (images, audio, video), and provides historical context. Evaluate whether the information architecture allows for easy navigation between related customs. Deduct 5 points if cultural documentation is sparse or inaccurate, 3 points if multimedia elements are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the forum/WeChat Moments-like feature functional and culturally appropriate?
checklist.description: Examine the social platform functionality, including post creation, commenting, image sharing, and user profiles. Check whether the UI adheres to familiar WeChat Moments patterns while incorporating Chaoshan cultural elements. Verify the implementation of privacy controls and content filtering. Score 0 if the forum feature is not implemented, 5 if basic posting functionality exists but lacks social interaction features, and 10 if the implementation includes robust interaction capabilities with cultural contextualization.

checklist.title: Is there proper integration between the calendar, cultural content, and social features?
checklist.description: Evaluate how well the three main components are integrated. Check if calendar events can be shared to the forum, if cultural content can be referenced in posts, and if user-generated content can enhance cultural documentation. Assess if the navigation between sections is intuitive. Deduct 5 points if components operate in isolation with minimal cross-functionality, 3 points if the integration exists but is cumbersome to use. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as network disconnections, invalid user inputs, missing cultural data, calendar date conversion errors) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AR visualization of Chaoshan customs 2. Dialect translation/pronunciation guide 3. Interactive cultural heritage map 4. AI-powered Chaoshan cultural assistant). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple news feeds with overlapping content) 2. Function modules unrelated to Chaoshan culture (e.g., general social media features that don't connect to the cultural focus) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations when displaying calendar events). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating cultural data/UI/network layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles while incorporating Chaoshan aesthetic elements: 1) Harmonious color matching (traditional Chaoshan colors used appropriately) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system that supports both standard and any special Chaoshan characters. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay â‰¤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance when switching between calendar, cultural content, and forum sections. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
